intro: Dasistoma serrata, commonly known as the serrated dasistoma, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and palmate leaves with serrated edges. It produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. The species is often found in moist, tropical environments and is adapted to thrive in humid conditions.
